newsitem.title: USA: Transco to seek approval for mainline plan.
newsitem.headline: Transco to seek approval for mainline plan.

text.p: Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Corp said on Thursday it planned to seek U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission approval to expand its mainline system.
The expansion would provide more annual firm transportation capacity to serve markets in Alabama and Georgia, the company said. Transco is one of the Williams Cos.

The proposed so-called Cherokee Expansion project would provide firm transportation capacity available November 1, 1998, extending from the interconnect between Transco's mainlines and Mobile Bay Lateral station to delivery upstream in Georgia, the company said.
Transco said the level of market commitment would determine the facilities, capacity and capital cost of the expansion.
